result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L Colby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 4 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Waukesha County Case 16CF328 BUT CONSECUTIVE to Racine County Case 15CF293.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the co-actor.
No contact with the Pick N Save store or Kwik Trip listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.

Restitution is ordered payable to Pick N Save and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharge as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard L Colby in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State filed 3 count read-in list. Read-in list dismissed and read-in. 
Defendant entered plea of guilty to count 3. Court found defendant guilty of count 3. Counts 1 and 2 dismissed and read-in. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 4 days) concurrent with 16CF328, but consecutive with Racine County case 15CF293. 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

STAYED FOR

2 YEARS PROBATION;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  

*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  codefendant, Pick N Save or Kwik Trip listed in complaint and/or read-in list;

RESTITUTION:  $90.96 on count 2 of the read-in list to Pick N Save and $154.91 on count 3 of the read-in list to Pick N Save to be paid as a condition of sentence - restitution to be paid before costs or fines;

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of sentence; COURT ORDERS CASH BAIL TO BE REFUNDED TO POSTER.

DNA SURCHARGE:  WAIVED BY COURT

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
